snippet: Lawmakers sought to tie the matter to the carrying out of President Obama’s health care law. Their charges range from clearly questionable actions to seemingly specious allegations.
abstract: Congressional Republicans are moving to broaden scope of Internal Revenue Service Inquiry to include agency's role in carrying out implementation of health care reform law, in hopes that it will ensnare Obama administration.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: Lawmakers sought to tie the matter to the carrying out of President Obama’s health care law. Their charges range from clearly questionable actions to seemingly specious allegations.

headline.main: Republicans Expand I.R.S. Inquiry, With Eye on White House
headline.print_headline: Republicans Broaden Scope of I.R.S. Inquiry, Hoping to Entangle White House

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
